capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm not a fan of the character Filch from Harry Potter, to be honest. He's always causing trouble and being quite mean to the students. I think he's just trying to cover up his own flaws by being strict all the time.

You know, I've noticed that the character of Filch in our school's stories is often portrayed as being quite strict and uptight. He's always on the lookout for misbehaving students, and his grumpy demeanor can be pretty intimidating. I think he's actually an adult, but at the same time, there's something endearing about his quirky personality that makes him hard to dislike.
